title: Mr. Lamont Stays All Night
description: Stu Erwin plays a mild-mannered high-school principal, with June Collyer as his wife.

title: Father Gets Into the Act
description: A film production company hits town and the Erwin youngsters are so intent on breaking into show business that they sign up with a bogus theatrical agent.

title: Telephonitis
description: Thanks to Willie, Stuart Erwin's listing in the new phone book is wrong. Now he's getting calls for a shady gangster named Erwin Stuart from his floozy girlfriend and "business" associates. A parade of unsavory types parade through Stu's home as he's trying to impress the membership director of the country club.

title: Springtime for Father
description: Stu and Harry are looking forward to a vacation camping in the wilderness, while their wives insist on a trip to glamorous New York.

title: Barbecue
description: When Drexel Potter, Joyce Erwin's love interest, starts to spend time with her rival because of her father's new barbecue pit, Stu decides to build his own.

title: Nothing But the Truth
description: After catching Jackie in a fib, Stu makes her swear to always tell the truth. Keeping her promise, she proceeds to cause a fight between Drexel and Joyce, insult a tacky-dressing neighbor, and tell rude Uncle George what everyone really thinks of him.

title: Hate the Love Seat
description: Stu jumps to conclusions and thinks June has spent their extra money on an second-hand love seat. Not knowing she simply accepted its delivery for a neighbor, he calls a junk-man to haul it away. It's off to the auction to buy it back.

title: In a Pickle
description: June and Adele decide to pit their pickle making skills by entering the county fair. Stu and Harry leave both jars on Stu's office desk and while the principal is distracted, Selkirk consumes both batches not realizing they were intended for the competition. Not willing to admit their blunder, the men decide to make their own pickles and enter the results under their wives' names.

title: The Big Game
description: On the eve of the big football game, Stu agrees with the opposing school's principal to forfeit the contest if one act of vandalism occurs on the opposing school's campus. The next day, Stu discovers that the statue from his rival's central square has been hidden in his basement.

title: Leave It to Stu
description: Alarmed at the rising price of groceries, Stu buys chickens and a cow to save on eggs and milk, with predictable, disastrous results.

title: In the Shade of the Old Family Tree
description: Townspeople make a big deal over the fact that Stu may be related to a Revolutionary War figure, and he's loving all the attention. A genealogist uncovers the embarrassing truth: Stu's ancestor was a traitor.

title: The Day the Circus Came to Town
The Pearl Necklace
description: Stu remembers the anniversary of his engagement for a change and buys his wife an string of imitation pearls. June mistakenly opens her neighbor's present to his wife, an expensive pearl necklace that's the real thing, and thinks that Stu bought them for her.
